meanings.definition: A fishing line with hooks attached, used for catching fish.
meanings.sent1: The fisherman cast his setline into the water, hoping for a big catch.
meanings.sent2: He carefully baited the setline before dropping it into the lake.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat thought the setline was a new toy to play with.
meanings.sent4: The setline danced in the water, tempting the fish with its shiny hooks.
meanings.sent5: The old sailor's setline was his most prized possession, filled with memories of the sea.

meanings.definition: To place or arrange in a particular position.
meanings.sent1: She decided to setline the books neatly on the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The artist carefully setlined the paints on the palette before starting to paint.
meanings.sent3: The children setlined their toys in a row, creating a colorful display.
meanings.sent4: His words setlined the audience's emotions, leaving them moved by his speech.
meanings.sent5: The gardener setlined the flowers in a beautiful pattern, creating a stunning garden display.

meanings.definition: To establish or fix in a specified place or position.
meanings.sent1: The architect needed to setline the foundation before building the house.
meanings.sent2: The teacher setlined the rules at the beginning of the school year.
meanings.sent3: The chef setlined the ingredients for the recipe, ready to start cooking.
meanings.sent4: Her determination setlined her path towards success, unwavering in her goals.
meanings.sent5: The leader setlined the vision for the team, guiding them towards a common goal.
